text: FALSE: Ugandan politician Rebecca Kadaga did not win NRM vice chairperson seat. The NRM Electoral Commission declared Anita Among the winner.
label: FAKE

text: FAKE: This Facebook post on NUP presidency is not by Bobi Wine. The politician disowned the post.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: President Trump did not sign an order requiring a US passport to purchase food and medicine. The US embassy in Uganda said there is no such directive.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Uganda’s former Speaker Rebecca Kadaga has not agreed to join the opposition. The video does not show Kadaga accepting Bobi Wine’s request to join the opposition.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Former Speaker Kadaga was not chased out of the NRM NEC meeting. A review of the full coverage of the meeting shows no evidence of such an incident.
label: FAKE

text: FAKE: Uganda’s Inspectorate of Government did not author this letter interdicting National Youth Council members. The Inspectorate has disowned the letter.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: President Museveni did not announce joining vocational education after primary school. The Education Ministry confirmed the allegations to be untrue.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE HEADLINE: This video doesn’t show President Museveni commenting on death of NUP activist Marinos. The headline of the YouTube video is both misleading and clickbait.
label: FAKE

text: ALTERED: This video of UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer announcing jobs under a free immigration programme is doctored. The video was edited using AI.
label: FAKE

text: ALTERED: This photo of Bobi Wine announcing a new ‘People Power’ uniform is manipulated. The original photo shows Bobi Wine dressed in a red attire with NUP party branding and not a military uniform.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Uganda’s Education Minister did not announce that there won’t be ‘A’ Level in 2026. Minister Janet Museveni was commenting about curriculum review, not halting ‘A’ Level in the original video.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Uganda’s President Museveni and his wife Janet are not dead. The couple has made public appearances days after the death claims were made.
label: FAKE

text: ALTERED: This video of Ugandan journalist Raymond Mujuni promoting a government financial platform… Mujuni and Daily Monitor disowned the purported interview, terming it a hoax.
label: FAKE

text: HOAX: This Uganda Electoral Commission job application portal is fake. The electoral body disowned the purported portal.
label: FAKE

text: MISSING CONTEXT: This photo of Ugandan PM Nabbanja is outdated. The photo dates back to July 2014, when Nabbanja was reportedly assaulted over her stance on roadblocks in her constituency.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Ugandan opposition politician Kizza Besigye remains in prison as of 31 July 2025. The original video of Besigye dancing is from a hearing where the Nakawa Chief Magistrate’s Court rejected an application to access the politician’s medical records.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Simon Byabakama, the chairman of Uganda’s Electoral Commission, has not resigned. State House and the Commission confirmed Byabakama is still the chairman.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Sheikh Shaban Mubajje is still the Mufti of Uganda. The Uganda Muslim Supreme Council has confirmed that the claims about Mubajje being overthrown and the position being vacant are false.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Ugandan opposition leader Kizza Besigye was not re-arrested in Kenya in 2025. Besigye has been in Luzira prison since 2024, and the video is AI-generated.
label: FAKE

text: FAKE: This X account spreading misinformation and posting as the Democratic Alliance of Uganda is an impostor. The Democratic Front party spokesperson stated that the Democratic Alliance pressure group’s X account has since been suspended.
label: FAKE

text: ALTERED: This photo of Uganda’s Prime Minister Nabbanja with facial injuries is manipulated. ALTERED: This photo of Uganda’s Prime Minister Nabbanja with facial injuries is manipulated. The photo has been edited and contains AI-generated or deepfake elements.
label: FAKE

text: ALTERED: This Sunday Monitor cover featuring a story on Uganda’s opposition is doctored. The publication has disowned it.
label: FAKE

text: HOAX: This NIRA account promising express National IDs is not authentic. NIRA has dismissed the account as fake and urged the public to ignore it, along with several other imposter accounts.
label: FAKE

text: ALTERED: Video showing Busoga king kneeling before President Museveni to receive vehicle donation is edited. The video was altered using AI.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Ugandan legislator Twaha Kagabo did not garner two votes in NRM primary elections. Kagabo got 2501 votes, coming second in a race of four.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: This video of Uganda’s President Museveni isn’t directed at his Kenyan counterpart Ruto. The video is from 2020 and unrelated to President Ruto’s sentiments.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: President Donald Trump did not order a total shutdown of US borders. The US mission in Uganda said travel to the US continues.
label: FAKE

text: FAKE: This NRM letter nullifying the nomination of Bosmic Otim is fabricated. NRM’s Electoral Commission disowned the letter.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: Uganda has not banned TikTok. The Ugandan government and social media users have dismissed the claim as false.
label: FAKE

text: FALSE: This alert does not prohibit Americans from travelling to Uganda. The post making the claim misinterprets advisories issued by the US Embassy in Uganda in June 2025.
label: FAKE

text: MISSING CONTEXT: This video does not show Eddie Mutwe, Bobi Wine’s bodyguard, after being released from prison in 2025. The claim video is of Eddie Mutwe after being released from prison in 2021.
label: FAKE
